term.name: contextualism
term.source: From Latin contextus: connected or weaved together.
term.def: The view that all entities are connected together; another word for &holism;.
The view that an entity cannot be known without understanding the full context of its connections to other entities.
The view that ethical value is not absolute but dependent on a specific personal, historical, or societal context.
The view that a work of art can be interpreted only in the light of its historical context.
